messages: 5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:10): Anyone know why my CD Drive isn't even showing up in the Device Manager?
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:12): Yeah
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:12): It won't read CD's or DVD's
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:12): did you move drives around or something?
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:12): It doesn't appear in Device Manager, or My Computer.
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:12): I don't think so.
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:14): bjv, Any ideas? I think it's an HP DVD Writer 640i.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:16): anecdotal: i have had an HP cd burner slowly grow flaky then fail
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:16): i fell back to an even older HP burner though. which has been rock solid, albeit x4 burn only
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:16): fail? as in don't work at all forever?
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:16): NOoo
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:17): booting with the drive connected became unreliable, it would detect, but trying to read would get nothing.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:17): if i killed the power and restarted like 40 times, i could eventually get a CD to boot the machine, but it whirred and screamed like a devil.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:18): but yours does not show up at all.
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:18): Well, it did.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:18): does it still eject, etc
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:18): It had a yellow exclamation mark next to it, then I uninstalled the drivers, now it doesn't show up.
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:18): Yeah
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:19): ah, you uninstalled the drivers
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:19): Windows
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:19): which Windows?
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:19): Home
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:20): When I tried to install the ones from the HP website, it said Device not found, but that's because there was no previous drivers.
5afdfde1217cc8903d2c63d2c3ea2941 (11:20): I assumed.

da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:20): this sounds like a windows-specific question. i have heard that you can uninstall a device in windows and it will vanish, but i dont know anything about that.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:21): try asking in #windows.   if they can find your device, chances of getting the drive back are good.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:37): (njdavid here)
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:37): bjv: Hey
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:43): Anyone alive?
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:43): bjv: You there?
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:48): woo: yes. they couldnt find the device?
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:50): The device shows up now bjv
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:50): But, it has a yellow exclamation mark next to it
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:50): I opened up the comp and disconnected the reconnected.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:52): bjv: What now? :(
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:52): when this yellow mark appeared, it stopped reading?
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:53): The mark means it's in a problem state
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:53): if you did not change settings, install new software, and it just clicked on one day         the hardware could have just failed
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:54): "Windows cannot load the device driver for this hardware. The driver may be corrupted or missing. (Code 39)"
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:54): ive used w2k abit,    ive only ever seen the yellow mark next to 'unknown device'
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:54): well, that sounds like your driver got corrupted or gone. :P
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:54): Heh yeah
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:54): i thought MS fixed that with ntfs.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:54): But when I try to download the ones on the hp site it says Devince not found
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:55): Because there are no drivers there.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:55): I'm assuming.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:55): you tried the drivers again now that you have your entry back?
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:56): maybe it's the wrong driver.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:56): what drivers were you using before?
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:56): What do you mean?
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:56): I don't know.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:56): I never messed with it 'till now.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:57): so the burner came with the computer.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:58): is there a Drivers or $OEM folder on your system drive?
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:58): In system32, yeah.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:59): those are probably the currently installed drivers.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (11:59): sometimes Dell/whoever leaves a folder  C:
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:59): Yeah, they are the currently installed.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (11:59): I've never owned a Dell, I'm not stupid enough to do that. :-P
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:00): lol, sometimes they are the cheapest out there though
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:01): if there isnt a C:\Drivers\CDROM\ or similar, ive seen a 'upgrade drivers' option on a friends XP home machine
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:01): can you get it to run the autodetect that way?
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:03): Upgrade Drivers?
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:04): properties on the device, in the manager
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:04): it may have been Reinstall Drivers, or something
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:05): Well there is an Update Drivers, thing but it doesn't work?
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:06): I wish I could find a way to extract the drivers from the exe.

a03b3218807474418821a504c6d334aa (12:06): Anyone know how to upgrade memory on a laptop? I've got an HP laptop with built-in RAM of 512MB and want to extend to 1GB total. Bought another chip that matches my system spec, but PC dies after 10 minutes with it onboard.  -> Do I need the *EXACT* same vendor for this to work?
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:06): i know about this only from putting together a 2000 server distro /w custom drivers.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:07): bjv: So how do I do it?
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:08): well i dont know. there may not be for your particular .exe
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:09): run it with   /?   and see what kind of options there are
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:09): there could be an /E or something to extract the files to a directory
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:10): Although it seems as if it's a firmware upgrade, not a driver.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:11): well, it seems you need to find out how to get a driver installed in win XP for this drive
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:12): there may be some underlying hardware issue, but it's hard to tell without drivers.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:12): I can't find the drivers anywhere.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:14): perhaps you can somehow figure out how to get a generic cdrom driver loaded in there
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:14): Well there is.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:14): so you can read disks?
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:14): But there are drivers loaded.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:14): But they seem generic.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:15): you have a drive letter for the drive
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:15): C:\WINDOWS\system32\DRIVERS\cdrom.sys
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:15): C:\WINDOWS\system32\DRIVERS\imapi.sys
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:15): C:\WINDOWS\system32\Drivers\PxHelp20.sys
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:15): C:\WINDOWS\system32\DRIVERS\redbook.sys
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:15): C:\WINDOWS\system32\storprop.dll
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:15): bjv: Nope.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:16): bjv: Only appears in Device Manager, and it shows with a yellow exclamation mark next to is.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:16): was the yellow error different before you uninstalled the driver?
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:17): it has always been a code XYZ, drivers missing or corrupt, then.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:17): The firmware upgrade has a fix labelled: "Fixed CD-ROM disc mount issue"
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:18): even an empty drive should have a letter made for it, though.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:20): i dont know.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:20): This blows.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:20): I was going to burn a Dapper Drake cd too, that's how I noticed it wasn't working.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:20): Damnit.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:20): all i can say is take your (Code 39) to #windows and google and try and get some generic drivers loaded properly, or the real ones if you can.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:21): im waiting for my dapper CD's still to come in the mail.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:21): Even those won't work for me.. :(
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:21): i may manage to finish the upgrade over my 56k before they show up.
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:22): Why no Broadband?
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:28): ha, i dont pay on the line. as i have a mobile phone.
da785166998520d8584f0a2e6a8aacf2 (12:29): and as a result, i only see $8/mo for my ISP and that's it
a6b173cd6259a3a3f8cb85b2190ca3d1 (12:40): I'm starting to get fucking pissed off.
